channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Sorry, retirees — the 4% rule won’t work for you if Vanguard is right about where the stock market is headed
item.description: A “lost decade” of low stock returns can be devastating for older investors

item.title: If you’re this type of investor, get out of the stock market now
item.description: Here’s what to do — depending on your age — with the economy and the stock market at a tipping point.

item.title: Americans’ affordability crisis isn’t tariffs’ fault — it’s something much, much deeper
item.description: Costs for the “Unaffordability Five” — housing, food, healthcare, child care and energy — were rising long before Trump’s trade war.

item.title: CDC group no longer recommends hepatitis B shot for newborns. This is what it means.
item.description: The committee also changed its recommendations for which babies should get the vaccine.

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

item.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
